Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2008 04:58PM Ellzig wrote: P.S. - I'm on Taxol after the A/C. (4 rounds every 2 weeks). Is this when the eyebrow pencil and eyebrow liner are needed?  This bothers me more than the hair 'cuz can't hide it. However, bald is bald.... gotta be me. Ellzig
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2008 04:47PM Ellzig wrote: Rock The Bald, You have been such an uplift for me. I started chemo Sept. 30. Took charge of the situation and had the head buzzed Oct. 3. I'm on A/C first 4 rounds (every 2 weeks) and onc. said I'd be losing my hair. I'm gonna read your May 08 posts. Thank you for the laughter! You make my day! Ellzig
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2008 08:36AM Ellzig wrote: Hi Everyone, Started chemo Sept. 30 - was very ill the first day, about 3 or 4 hours out. However, next day ok and today I'm ok - just very tired. I'd have to say the first day was the worst for me, but I'm learning to take my meds BEFORE nausea hits. Newbie, will get the hang of it. I wish all of you the best as you start - once we get one behind us, then we just keep counting down. I pray for very little SE's for all of us, especially the nausea. Love, Ellzig
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2008 03:09PM Ellzig wrote: Hi Everyone, I'm also on the starting chemo in Sept 08 board, but wanted to log on here, since I will be starting on Sept. 30. I will have AC 4x every 2 wks and T 4x every 2 weeks. I will let you know how I make out and SE's. I'm going to drink plenty of water before hand, keeping myself well hydrated. Also maybe a laxative, for constipation. I already bought a wig and will be buzzed Oct. 3 (don't want to watch my long brown hair fall out). I look forward to getting to know other ladies with bc as we go through this journey. The best thing for me I've found is my faith in God and a crazy sense of humor. It helps alot! Ellzig
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2008 05:24PM Ellzig wrote: Bourscheid - thank you for the prayers! You ladies are in mine, as well. It's a comfort to be able to talk to all of you. Thanks for making our list of ladies. Fammy5 - I have to take a steroid with the AC. I heard the same thing that it keeps you up. On the bottle it says to take it at night (??). I wonder if we can take tylenol PM with all this stuff so we can get some sleep. I'll ask the Onc on Tuesday. What do you do with the tea tree oil? Ellzig
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2008 11:49AM Ellzig wrote: Dear Bourscheid, You are in my thoughts and prayers as all of you are. Please keep posting SE''s and how you are doing! I'm going back to work on Monday Oct. 6th can't stand to stay home any longer - want to get back on track. Day 3 so far so good, just a little tired. I know what you mean about getting to work - staying at home is no good - even if you get our for an hour!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2008 09:41PM Ellzig wrote: Hi Girls, Hope everyone is doing ok - Lori, the cancer center where I go seems to be hoppin' too. Thought it was 'cuz I lived in New Jersey... I find now I need to take a nap around 4:00 everyday - but as the days are going by I seem to be ok. Just the heartburn is a drag. Had constipation, now it seems it's going the other way. When I go to work tomorrow they moved me to an office - I'll be able to "trot" to a bathroom nearby (work in a school). I've started to notice bone pain in my foot of all places! Go figure... Ladies, let me know how you are doing during the week. Water and gingerale have been my drinks du jour lately. Actually ate out with friends yesterday which was really encouraging. Ellen

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2008 01:03PM Ellzig wrote: Hi Everyone, I haven't been on in a while - can anyone tell me what Taxol is going to be like? I've done 3rd AC (one more to go, yay!). I'm having a bit of trouble with SE's right now and am concerned. Thanks!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2008 01:26PM Ellzig wrote: Hi Everyone, Had my head buzzed yesterday - man, your noggin' gets cold at night!! Get a cap if you haven't already. Thankfully the wig is ok - pretty much matched my hairstyle so I should be good to go on Monday. So far no pain from Neulasta shot on the 1st, took Claritan. Anyone know about tea tree oil shampoo? They used it on my head yesterday and it felt so good! How about lotions and creams when we start losing the hair and the scalp gets dry? I'm not wearing my wig at home.... Next Chemo is Oct. 14. Does anyone know if each chemo is worse and worse? I hope not.

Posts.Title: If you are not Stage IV but have questions, you may post here chrissyb Olma61

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2014 05:27AM Ellzig wrote: Hi I have a question and could use some direction please. Rheumatologist or oncologist? I had X-rays done in August for pain in my neck and back. Pain was intermittent at that time. Now it's constant and pain running down arms and lower back starting in. X-rays said degenerative arthritis. I of course like that answer... but should I see my onc earlier than January and tell him about this? Or am I being stupid? Been going on since the summer. Orig DX 2008 finished chemo 2009. Stage II IDCgrade2 1 lymph node, extra capsular extension w/ lympho vascular invasion. Thanks for listening and any input! not on any AI's..
